main event: On April 4, 1959, in Big Spring, Texas, three orange colored lights were observed moving rapidly, traveling in a straight line, and disappearing instantaneously. Radar indicated that the unknown objects were likely weather balloons. The observation lasted for about 2 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed to be moving rapidly when first sighted, then slowed almost to a halt before accelerating again in a quite strange manner.
The objects were seen moving from west to east, climbing rapidly to the northwest before slowing almost to a complete halt, then started climbing straight up rapidly before going out of sight.

The objects were observed to be round with a greenish blue glow, egg shaped with one tail, white with blue edges, and round/flat slightly pointed at each end with white or cream in the middle and reddish orange around the edge.
The witnesses observed the rapidly moving unidentified object without sound and watched it for 3 to 4 minutes.
The observation was considered to be well documented and reliable, with all observers giving identical reports of the sightings.
witnesses: civilians, including a schoolteacher, a student, and a petroleum maintenance technician
